content: Get your daily, bite-sized digest of blockchain and crypto news today – investigating the stories flying under the radar of today’s news.
In crypto news today:
The global crypto market capitalization has seen a notable increase over the past 24 hours and after several days of declining numbers.
It went up 5.9% to $2.51 trillion.Nearly all top 100 coins per market cap are also up today. Only three have seen drops.
PEPE is down 6.1% to $0.00001065.
It’s followed by Toncoin (TON)’s 3.5% and Tron (TRX)’s 0.5% to $6.75 and $0.1247, respectively.
On the other hand, the best performer among the 100 is Fantom (FTM). Its price increased by 25%, trading at $0.8079.
SEI is up 19.8% to $0.5481, followed by BEAM’s 19.6% to $0.0254.¬†Twenty other coins have seen double-digit increases.
When it comes to the top 10 coins per market cap, all but Toncoin are green today. Solana (SOL)is the best performer, having increased by 13.2% to $163.
The second-best is Bitcoin (BTC). It appreciated 6.5%, currently trading at $66.171.
Ethereum (ETH) is up 3.75%, changing hands at $3,019.All remaining coins are up around 3%, except Dogecoin (DOGE)which increased by 4.6%.
Meanwhile, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) is reportedly planning to launch Bitcoin trading, seeking to capitalize on the growing demand for BTC among Wall Street fund managers this year.

In crypto news today, the Worldcoin Foundation has launched its secure multi-party computation (SMPC) system with the goal of setting a new standard for data protection, including the protection of biometric data.
Following the migration of the scanned iris codes to the new SMPC system, the previous uniqueness-checking system, including iris codes, was permanently and securely deleted, the press release said.
The new system is open-sourced and available in a GitHub repository for any organization to use.
SMPC can be thought of as “taking one secret and sharing it in multiple parts across different parties for increased protection,” the announcement said.
However, none of the individual parts alone say anything about the secret, making it impossible to decrypt.

Meanwhile, SMPC systems are too resource-intensive to be effectively used for large complex computations.
So, despite being an excellent privacy protection tool, they haven’t yet been extensively used in biometric template protection.

The Worldcoin Foundation and contributor-technologists from TACEO and Tools for Humanity say that they have “successfully architected a new implementation of SMPC to address the scale and cost constraints that have previously hindered others.”
The new SMPC system encrypts iris codes into secret shares held by multiple parties, which by themselves cannot be related to an identified person.

Netki, a digital identity verification solutions provider, has announced the launch of their compliance oracle, DeFi Sentinel, on Sui, a Layer 1 blockchain and smart contract platform.¬†Per the press release, the integration introduces an essential tool for developers. The tool automates compliance within their protocols.

This means that developers can “focus on shipping high-impact projects instead of spending time developing tools to meet complex, ever-changing regulations that often differ across jurisdictions,” the Netki team said.
Therefore, DeFi Sentinel enables developers to meet both institutional and regulatory requirements through a one-time integration.

The oracle provides real-time KYC/AML, wallet screening, financial transaction monitoring, securities compliance, and tax compliance. Per the ream, “Netki’s DeFi compliance oracle is unique in the industry, enabling transaction-by-transaction compliance, which is crucial for institutional adoption of DeFi tools.” Moreover, it combines on-chain and off-chain data to ensure regulatory and institutional compliance for each transaction.

Furthermore, Sui will integrate Netki’s OnboardID. Protocols that enable this solution see improved user onboarding and identity verification processes, said the announcement.¬†It also reduces costs and simplifies compliance around the onramping process for Sui developers’ applications.
In other crypto news today, peaq, the layer-1 blockchain for DePIN and Machine RWAs (real-world assets), is joining Mastercard Start Path as part of the program’s latest cohort.
Through the payments giant’ program, peaq will explore various prospective implementations connecting the DePIN sector and the world of traditional finance and fintech, it said.
This includes outfitting machines on native DePINs leveraging Mastercard’s network to make transactions easier between the ecosystem and the fiat space.
Furthermore, the program will help peaq provide its ecosystem with new opportunities to secure strategic partnerships, build their communities, raise funds, etc.

The press release stated that TradFi and DePIN integration is “one of the technological integration scenarios peaq and Mastercard will explore as part of the Start Path program.”

Mastercard will also provide opportunities to access its network of partners, mentorship opportunities and resources to support peaq’s scaling journey, remarked Sabrina Tharani, SVP of Global Fintech Programs at Mastercard.
The team stated that “through Start Path, peaq has the opportunity to accelerate adoption, ensure compliance and legitimacy, and foster trust and user empowerment in Web3 and beyond.”
Per Till Wendler, co-founder of peaq, the partnership “will pave the way to easy interactions between DePINs and TradFi services, enabling millions of Web2 natives to join this transition.”
